page.title: 171ST BALLOCH GUIDES
page.content: Guides are an organisation that started 75 years ago by a man called Baden Powell who also started the Brownies, Scouts and the Cubs which are similar organisations. The Guide uniform consists of a blue blouse, a navy skirt, a thick leather belt which is optional, a blue hat which has a badge on it and different companies have different colours of neckerchiefs . Balloch Guide Company has a sky blue neckerchief. In every guide company there is a selection of patrols, each patrol has a different name, for example Snowdrop,Bluebell, Daffodil, Thistle and White Rose. Every patrol has a badge indicating their name. Balloch Guide Company meets in Balloch Village Hall at 6.45pm till 8.15pm on Wednesday. Not all companies meet at this time.
